prompt: 61 M bronch note. J96.00. findings: granulation tissue in RMSB causing mild narrowing. cleared secretions from Right Mainstem and RLL. no comps.
completion:
NOTE_ID: note_100
SOURCE_FILE: note_100.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 61-year-old male who presents with suspected granulation tissue obstruction.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.00 Respiratory Failure

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.00 Respiratory Failure

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration, subsequent episodes (CPT 31646)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing (CPT 31622)

ANESTHESIA
Local ONLY. Lidocaine applied to vocal cords, trachea, and bilateral mainstem bronchi.

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS
None.

COMPLICATIONS
None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
A timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Airway Inspection

Trachea: The tracheostomy tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber and the carina is sharp.

Extent: The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level.

Right Lung Findings:
Exophytic granulation tissue noted at the distal Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB), causing 40% luminal narrowing. No necrotic debris observed.

Left Lung Findings:
The Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB) is patent with healthy mucosa. No granulation tissue seen.
Segmental airways on the left are widely patent.

Secretions: Minimal frothy secretions.

Interventions

Therapeutic Aspiration: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem and RLL from mucus.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)
None.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
Consider laser ablation or cryotherapy for RMSB granulation tissue in future session if symptoms worsen.
Likely on [REDACTED].

NOTE_ID: note_100

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 83-year-old male who presents with severe mucous plugging and hypoxia.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.10 Chronic Respiratory Failure

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.10 Chronic Respiratory Failure

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration, subsequent episodes (CPT 31646)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing (CPT 31622)

ANESTHESIA
Local ONLY. Lidocaine applied to vocal cords, trachea, and bilateral mainstem bronchi.

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS
None.

COMPLICATIONS
None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
A timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Airway Inspection

Trachea: The tracheostomy tube is patent. Tracheal mucosa shows mild inflammation.

Extent: The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level.

Right Lung Findings:
Significant amount of thick, tenacious secretions noted in the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB) extending into the lower lobes. No endobronchial lesions or stenosis identified after clearance.

Left Lung Findings:
The Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB) contains moderate mucoid secretions. Mucosa appears erythematous but patent.
Segmental airways on the left are widely patent.

Secretions: Minimal frothy secretions.

Interventions

Therapeutic Aspiration: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea, Bilateral Mainstems, and all segmental airways from mucus.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)
None.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
Continue aggressive pulmonary toilet and nebulizer treatments. Repeat bronchoscopy if lobar collapse recurs.
Likely on [REDACTED].

completion:
NOTE_ID: note_100
SOURCE_FILE: note_100.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 45-year-old female who presents with bronchial anastomotic dehiscence and stenosis.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.90 Acute Respiratory Failure

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J96.90 Acute Respiratory Failure

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration, subsequent episodes (CPT 31646)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing (CPT 31622)

ANESTHESIA
Local ONLY. Lidocaine applied to posterior oropharynx, vocal cords, and carina.

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS
None.

COMPLICATIONS
None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
A timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Airway Inspection

Trachea: The tracheostomy tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber and the carina is sharp.

Extent: The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level.

Right Lung Findings:
Airway exam notable for persistent pale plaque of tissue along the anterior wall of the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB), Bronchus Intermedius (BI), and Right Middle Lobe (RML) orifice. The RML orifice is now completely stenosed by overlying necrotic debris. Unable to probe into the airway to achieve patency.

Left Lung Findings:
The Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB) anastomosis shows mild granulation tissue and similar pale soft tissue plaque along the anterior aspect of the distal LMSB.
Segmental airways on the left are widely patent.

Secretions: Clear secretions noted bilaterally.

Interventions

Therapeutic Aspiration: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, and RLL and LLL from mucus.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)
None.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
Plan for bronchoscopy under GA for management of RML stenosis—likely excision of overlying debris, balloon dilation, and stent placement.
Likely on [REDACTED].

Left Lung Findings:
The Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB) anastomosis shows mild granulation tissue and similar pale soft tissue plaque along the anterior aspect of the distal LMSB.
Segmental airways on the left are widely patent.

Secretions: Minimal frothy secretions.

Interventions

Therapeutic Aspiration: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, and RLL and LLL from mucus.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

None.

Plan for bronchoscopy under GA for management of RML stenosis—likely excision of overlying debris, balloon dilation, and stent placement.

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 83-year-old female who presents with severe mucous plugging and hypoxia.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.01 Bronchial Stenosis

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.01 Bronchial Stenosis

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration, subsequent episodes (CPT 31646)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with cell washing (CPT 31622)

ANESTHESIA
Local ONLY. Lidocaine applied to trachea, main carina, RMS, and LMS.

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS
None.

COMPLICATIONS
None.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
A timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Airway Inspection

Trachea: The tracheostomy tube is patent. Tracheal mucosa shows mild inflammation.

Extent: The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level.

Right Lung Findings:
Significant amount of thick, tenacious secretions noted in the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB) extending into the lower lobes. No endobronchial lesions or stenosis identified after clearance.

Left Lung Findings:
The Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB) contains moderate mucoid secretions. Mucosa appears erythematous but patent.
Segmental airways on the left are widely patent.

Secretions: Thick, white secretions noted throughout.

Interventions

Therapeutic Aspiration: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea, Bilateral Mainstems, and all segmental airways from mucus.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

None.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
Continue aggressive pulmonary toilet and nebulizer treatments. Repeat bronchoscopy if lobar collapse recurs.
